text: Sha (Ш, ш) is the twenty-third letter in the Cyrillic alphabet. It sounds like [ʃ]. Its lowercase italic form is ш. It comes from the Hebrew letter shin. It is transliterated into the Roman alphabet as sh in English, sch in German, ch in French, ş in Turkish, sz in Polish and š in most Slavic languages (Czech, Slovak, Serbian, Slovene, Croatian) using Gaj's latin aphabet. ==Related pages== *Shin (letter) *Щ, щ - Shcha (Cyrillic)
title: Sha (Cyrillic)
